intro: Fimbristylis sechellensis, commonly known as the Seychelles sedge, is a flowering plant native to the Seychelles islands. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant typically grows in wet, swampy areas and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in spikelets, a common feature in sedges. Fimbristylis sechellensis is of conservation interest due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity.
